account_sid.description: The unique ID that identifies your Twilio account. Starts with `AC` and can be found on the Settings -> General page (https://www.twilio.com/console/project/settings).

auth_token.description: Your secret token to access your Twilio account. Keep this safe - DO NOT check this into source control!

endpoint.description: Allows you to change the Twilio API endpoint. Nearly everyone will leave this blank; Twilions may find use of this setting, though!

address_requirements.description: Address requirements imposed on this number, if any.

address_sid.description: SID of the address associated with this phone number. May be required for certain countries.

area_code.description: Look for a number within this area code.

country_code.description: Two letter ISO country code in which you want to search for a number. See https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223183068-Twilio-international-phone-number-availability-and-their-capabilities for details on available countries.

date_created.description: The date the phone number was created.

date_updated.description: The date the phone number was laste updated.

friendly_name.description: A friendly, human-readable name by which you can refer to this number.

identity_sid.description: SID of the identity associated with the phone number. May be required in certain countries.

is_beta.description: Whether or not this phone number is new to Twilio (beta status).

is_mms_capable.description: Whether or not this phone number is MMS-capable.

is_sms_capable.description: Whether or not this phone number is SMS-capable.

is_voice_capable.description: Whether or not this phone number is voice-capable..

number.description: The full phone number, including country and area code.

search.description: Look for this number sequence anywhere in the phone number.

sid.description: The unique identifier for this phone number.

trunk_sid.description: SID of the voice trunk that will handle calls to this number. If set, overrides any voice URLs or applications: only the trunk will recieve the incoming call.

address_sid.description: SID of the address used for emergency calling from this number. The address must be validated before it can be used for emergency purposes.

status.description: Status of this phone number. Either `active` or `inactive`.

application_sid.description: SID of the Twilio application to invoke when an SMS is sent to this number.

fallback_http_method.description: The HTTP method for the fallback URL. Can be `GET` or `POST`, defaults to `POST`.

fallback_url.description: The URL called if the primary URL returns a non-favorable status code.

primary_http_method.description: The HTTP method for the primary URL. Can be `GET` or `POST`, defaults to `POST`.

primary_url.description: The URL called when an SMS is sent to this number.

http_method.description: The HTTP method for the status callback URL. Can be `GET` or `POST`, defaults to `POST`.

url.description: The URL called when a whenever a status change occurs on this number.

application_sid.description: SID of the Twilio application to invoke when a call is started with this number.

caller_id_enabled.description: If caller ID is enabled or not for this number. If enabled, incurs additional charge per call (see console for pricing). Can be `true` or `false`, defaults to `false`.

fallback_http_method.description: The HTTP method for the fallback URL. Can be `GET` or `POST`, defaults to `POST`.

fallback_url.description: The URL called if the primary URL returns a non-favorable status code.

primary_http_method.description: The HTTP method for the primary URL. Can be `GET` or `POST`, defaults to `POST`.

primary_url.description: The URL called when a phone call starts on this number.

receive_mode.description: Determines if the line is set up for voice or fax. Can be `voice` or `fax`, defaults to `voice`.
